prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Data rate: Data rate of our observation is 21.7 MB/s, which is one-third of the maximum data rate is 60 MB/s. If this value is not available we revise our spectral setup to observe by reduce of number of spectral lines.

Data rate: Data rate of our observation is 21.7 MB/s, which is one-third of the maximum data rate is 60 MB/s. If this value is not available we revise our spectral setup to observe by reduce of number of spectral lines.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose 86GHz and 110 GHz imaging of colliding molecular clumps that has formed W49A, one of the most active and luminous region of massive star formation in the Galaxy. ALMA can show us the complex structures at the interface with a high fidelity. The obtained image would reveal how massive clumps are collided and how massive stars are formed at the shocked and in massive clumps.

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: Graduate School of Science, The University of Tokyo
